#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Magnitogorsk apartment building collapses after explosion , dozens dead
#Text=Friday , January 4 , 2019
#Text=An apartment building collapsed on Monday in Magnitogorsk , a city in the Ural region of Russia .
#Text=A suspected gas leak led to an explosion , followed by the ten-storey building coming down .
#Text=A total of 39 are confirmed dead , officials told state media , adding that rescuers ended their work yesterday .
#Text=Some reports suggest a deliberate criminal act .
#Text=A file photo showing a view of Magnitogorsk .
#Text=Image : АлександрВ . И . via Panaramio .
#Text=The 1973 building was home to over 1,000 people ; 48 apartments were damaged .
#Text=Rescuers , working in temperatures well below freezing , according to the emergencies ministry recovered at least ten survivors from the debris on Monday .
#Text=The building was evacuated .
#Text=Over 1,000 rescuers responded .

#Text=The Investigative Committee and the Federal Security Service ( FSB ) said they believe gas , which leaks relatively frequently in Russia , was the trigger for the disaster which occurred at 6am as many occupants slept .
#Text=President Vladimir Putin was briefed , and flew to Magnitogorsk on Monday , observing the rescue mission and visiting the wounded in hospital .

#Text=In a meeting that day he was told by Emergencies Minister Yevgeny Zinichev of " presumably between 36 and 40 people under the rubble " , while Chelyabinsk regional Deputy Governor Oleg Klimov indicated 68 people were missing .

#Text=Search and rescue was suspended on Tuesday , with Zinichev describing the " real threat of [ another ] part of the building collapsing " as making it " impossible to continue working in such conditions " , and work launched to stabilise the remaining structure .
#Text=He estimated this would take 24 hours .
#Text=Cranes were used to hoist workers into position to demolish sections deemed dangerous .
#Text=Rescue work resumed on Wednesday , with additional bodies recovered increasing the confirmed death toll from fourteen to 31 .
#Text=President Putin pictured in Magnitigorsk after arriving there in response to the disaster .
#Text=Image : Администрация Президента России .
#Text=" The search and rescue operation is complete , " Deputy Emergency Situations Minister Alexander Chupriyan told TASS on Wednesday .
#Text=Chelyabinsk 's governor has promised each victim will be subject to a payout of one million rubles .
#Text=Health Minister Veronika Skvortsova indicated on Monday the chances of those trapped being found alive were already diminishing .
#Text=On Tuesday an eleven-month-old boy , identified only as Ivan , was rescued alive and flown to Moscow for treatment of injuries including frostbite , leg fractures , and head trauma .
#Text=He was found under rubble , still in his cot after having been trapped for over 30 hours .
#Text=Ivan 's condition was on Wednesday reported to not be life-threatening .
#Text=The Emergencies Ministry said six deaths were of children .
#Text=On the night of Monday to Tuesday another explosion hit a gas-powered minibus in the city .
#Text=Officials said three people died ; their identities were not provided .
#Text=Both explosions took place on Karl Marx Avenue , within two miles of each other .
#Text=Officials including Putin at a meeting in Magnitogorsk on Monday .
#Text=Image : Администрация Президента России .
#Text=It 's impossible to continue working in such conditions — Zinichev calling a temporary halt to rescue work ahead of emergency stabilisation works
#Text=The FSB denies the two explosions are related ; reports describe speculation the disaster 's cause was not in fact a gas leak .
#Text=One news site , Znak.com , claims FSB sources have ascribed the explosion to terrorism .

#Text=The Investigative Committee says it has found no trace of explosives despite Znak.com claiming an anonymous source described a second-floor apartment being used as an explosives depot ahead of a planned shopping centre bombing .
#Text=Znak.com further reported its source said that apartment 's tenant moved in the day before the blast .
#Text=Regional governor Boris Dubrovsky said FSB officers were present where the minibus exploded outside the local administrative building , but said this too was unrelated to the other explosion .
#Text=Znak.com reported its source said " three terrorists " were killed in a firefight on Monday night , while footage from the scene showed the vehicle burn amid what sounds like gunfire .
#Text=The website further reported its anonymous source claimed a fourth offender escaped and remains wanted .
#Text=Monday saw armed police with dogs searching a second apartment block in Magnitigorsk .
#Text=Residents there told the press the officers claimed to be seeking a bomb .
